feed.title: KnowsCount’s Blog
feed.subtitle: I am a young front-end developer.

entry.title: 🍃 On Seeing a Boston Ivy
entry.content:
Within the city’s bustling node,
I walk’d amongst the streets;
I saw some trees along the road,
Some leaves that from it sheets.

The trees doth grow in selfsame mien,
Their gaps all two feet wide;
The leaves doth dye a selfsame green,
And trunks in same tint dyed.

I turn’d and saw a shrubbery,
—A tamèd thing forlorn:
Although its leaves were blubbery,
Its liberty was shorn.

But there upon a metal wall,
Grew green of varying hue:
This rebel in the urban pall,
Puts on a zesty shew!

Its forelimb ripe and mighty clasp’d
Around the modish wall:
The valour grim wherewith it grasp’d,
Is thrilling to recall.

No dainty blossoms gardens grow
Can match thine ardent soul:
O thou that thrives and for life plough
My worship thy nerve stole!
entry.summary: Within the city’s bustling node, I walk’d amongst the streets; I saw some trees along the road, Some leaves that from it sheets.

entry.title: 🌳 Upon a Wall in West Forest

link.title: 🌳 Upon a Wall in West Forest

entry.content:
Here a ridge yet there a peak,
Different distance difference sees;
Shifting changes muddle wreak:
Truth is blurr’d among its trees.

横看成岭侧成峰
远近高低各不同
不识庐山真面目
只缘身在此山中
entry.summary: Here a ridge yet there a peak, Different distance difference sees; Shifting changes muddle wreak: Truth is blurr’d among its trees.

entry.title: 🐲 QingMing
entry.content:
Rain of Qingming skies befell,
Mien of passers sorrow tell;
‘Does a pub house somewhere lie?’
‘Yon it does, in village nigh.’

original text by Mu Du:

清明时节雨纷纷
路上行人欲断魂
借问酒家何处有
牧童遥指杏花村
entry.summary: Rain of Qingming skies befell, Mien of passers sorrow tell; ‘Does a pub house somewhere lie?’ ‘Yon it does, in village nigh.’

entry.title: 🌳 ‘Should Selfsame Piles our City Growth Must Raise’

link.title: 🌳 ‘Should Selfsame Piles our City Growth Must Raise’

entry.content:
Should selfsame piles our city growth must raise
Upon the land where Nymphs and Fauns abide,
Where birds on cypress gaily sing to praise
The pastures green, that meadow spreading wide:
Let garments green not cede their dwelling place,
Nor creatures bold their long-reigned land resign;
For blocks upon them built are but disgrace
—To Nature, and to Gaia’s grand design.
And if by human’s ruthless gears they made
To conquer Nature—quench her gentle mien—
Shall she be curb’d, against them do crusade!
Arise, ye mountains, blooms and skies serene:
Like Men should fight for right and truth do fight
With thy great might—till day o’erlay thy night.
entry.summary: Should selfsame piles our city growth must raise Upon the land where Nymphs and Fauns abide, Where birds on cypress gaily sing to praise The pastures green, that meadow spreading wide: Let garments green not cede their dwelling place, Nor creatures bold their long-reigned land resign; For blocks upon them built are but disgrace —To Nature, and to Gaia’s grand design. And if by human’s ruthless gears they made To conquer Nature—quench her gentle mien— Shall she be curb’d, against them do crusade! Arise, ye mountains, blooms and skies serene: Like Men should fight for right and truth do fight With thy great might—till day o’erlay thy night.

entry.title: 🫀 To Emily
entry.content:
I look at you and not a phrase
Arises inside me:
For not at all a human praise
Could match that charm of thee.

I look at you and, smiling, you
Dost look back unto me;
Such rendezvous of sights of two,
Makes souls in shyness flee!

‘I dreamt of thee: O, dost thou know,
And didst thou dream of me?
Then didst thee dreaming true love show,
And hath I shown mine thee?’

You blush, I smile, as I am thrilled
To hear you answer me:
You smiled as well, like sea distilled,
One hears no speech from thee.

Your lips were still but dear eyes thine
Didst sing your love to me:
‘Indeed—’ they grinned ‘this heart of mine
With love does pound for thee.

‘I saw you under nooks and leaves,
Awaiting none but me—
Same sickness of sweet love conceives,
That I should dream of thee.

‘I miss you true, and love you too,
You own this heart in me:
For now I dwell in thought of you
And kiss’s shall set me free.’

And thus I kissed you on your cheeks
Just like you kissèd me:
And there my tears ran two long creeks,
Just like the tears of thee.
entry.summary: I look at you and not a phrase Arises inside me: For not at all a human praise Could match that charm of thee.

entry.title: 🐉 Pining for Home on Ninth of September

link.title: 🐉 Pining for Home on Ninth of September

entry.content:
In distant village lonely dwell,
A yearn of home in festive bell;
My brother steps unto the heights,
And misses me, in cornel rites.

original text:

独在异乡为异客
每逢佳节倍思亲
遥知兄弟登高处
遍插茱萸少一人
entry.summary: In distant village lonely dwell, A yearn of home in festive bell; My brother steps unto the heights, And misses me, in cornel rites.

entry.title: 😲 A Late Dream
entry.content:
was it a vision, or a waking dream?
fled is that music:—do I wake or sleep?
—Keats

She shut her eyes upon her bed,
And beauty glows about;
The beam of glamour ‘round her head,
A bard could only doubt.

She lays on bed a nakèd wise:
And I am standing by;
—To feel the wishes in her eyes
The world I would defy.

The head upon my shoulder seeks
To think it carefully;
But lo!—how blushful are her cheeks:
I lay down carelessly.

Her damask lips grow fairer still
—Like cherry dews herself;
The soft white bosom, like a hill,
Is plump upon this elf.

The eyes of ink, and hair of silk
Have found their place on me;
Complexion hers is white as milk,
My eyesight leaves not she.

The falls of ink upon her head
Doth flow like inmost dream:
—the lock of hair that half abed
How sleek and smooth doth seem!

Her eyes emit voracious lust,
A lust that I obey:
For with an ardour full robust,
Beside her I do lay.

My arms then ‘round her breasts doth twine
And mouth agapèd wide;
My hands then claspèd ‘round the shrine
Behind her bras unti’d.

Her legs curl upwards slightly bent,
And gapeth wide apart;
She nods her head and gave consent
For me to make a start.

I hold her hands and grab her knee,
As quick as light’ning’s leap;
But looking up I see not she:
A shadow nigh me creep.

My mind then mocks my boyishness:
I was in dreamland deep!
That little nymph who dwells in me
Had lullèd me asleep!

I open my unwilling eyes
Towards the rising beam:
If I should die with her anigh
—How well such dying seem!
entry.summary: was it a vision, or a waking dream? fled is that music:—do I wake or sleep? —Keats

entry.title: 🌕 Dear Queen Moon
entry.content:
Raindrops fiercer
Can never stop her:
The rising of the
Dear Queen Moon.

Sun hides thither,
Birds chirp yonder,
—all just for the
Dear Queen Moon.

Night grew darker,
But glows all ‘round her,
For she is our
Dear Queen Moon.

Watch her closer:
Above the heather,
Where stars ‘round cluster
Dear Queen Moon.

Many’s lover,
Than beauty fairer;
Selene we hight her:
Dear Queen Moon.

Sing together,
Dance forever;
For we are under
Dear Queen Moon.
entry.summary: Raindrops fiercer Can never stop her: The rising of the Dear Queen Moon.

entry.title: 🧳 A Friend During an Expedition
entry.content:
—how is andy tireless?

The team is weary in the green
Of finding scenes unseen;
We hadn’t even strength to speak:
We limpèd nigh asleep.

Nor had I the heart to check
Yon pathways spick and speck;
Yet had he the strength to seek
Yon hidden mountain-peek.

entry.title: 🥲 Lockdown
entry.content:
During the lockdown dull and dim,
I took a walk nearby;
Sipping a tea by glass’ brim,
Cars passèd by and by.

Unto the heavens clear and bright,
My spirit went with sight;
And did the beaming sun well-nigh
Heedfully hear me sigh:

— ‘Is it so that we o’ercame
Virus who sickens all?
Or is it so its fiery flame,
Has made our lives seem small?’
entry.summary: During the lockdown dull and dim, I took a walk nearby; Sipping a tea by glass’ brim, Cars passèd by and by.
